channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Europe and UK persuade Trump they're relevant to Ukraine's future?
item.description: Europe's hastily convened security summit in Paris is proof of leaders' anxiety about their role in defending Ukraine, the BBC's Katya Adler writes.

item.title: At least 10 dead in US floods and heavy rain
item.description: Kentucky has seen the worst effects of the rain so far, reporting at least nine dead.

item.title: China anger as US amends wording on Taiwan independence
item.description: Beijing has slammed the US State Department, calling for it to "immediately correct its mistakes".

item.title: Popular actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found dead in her home
item.description: Kim Sae-ron, an award-winning South Korean actor whose career was derailed after a 2022 DUI accident, was found dead in her house, police said.

item.title: Some in Hurricane Helene-ravaged North Carolina embrace Trump’s push to abolish FEMA

item.title: Man opens fire in Miami Beach when he saw "two Palestinians," docs say
item.description: The 27-year-old was arrested and charged with two counts of attempted murder for Saturday night's shooting.

item.title: Why Saudi Arabia is the venue of choice for Trump talks on Ukraine
item.description: The kingdom has gone from pariah to potential peacemaker in recent years.

item.title: Train hoppers ride the rails across America — and you can tag along
item.description: Civil War-era hobos hopped trains to find work. Content creators hop trains with their GoPros. Hitching rides on the railroad is an American tradition...

item.title: Trump appeals to Supreme Court over firing of US agency boss
